Params: Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory528.jpg
Babylonia's banquet hall is aglow with lights everywhere.
The awards ceremony is underway—and given the venue's set-up and the guest list, one can tell that WGAA takes this ceremony very seriously.
Ayla is now on the stage giving a speech—in the coating she changed into for the ceremony. With her hat slanted and a semiformal style, she sports the look of a serious pop artist.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory546.jpg
Ayla
Commandant, check out this new coating that I came up with for my new frame!
Ayla
You're the first one to see me in it! So, what do you say?
Ayla
See my semiformal style with the look of a serious pop artist? I couldn't be happier with the neckline design.
Looking great.
Ayla
I know, right?
Ayla does a spin to show off her new coating.
Ayla
This is the first coating I came up with for my new frame, and I can't even tell you how hard I worked on it.
Ayla
Look, I made this pink color specifically for this coating...
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory528.jpg
With her usual smile, Ayla carries on with her speech on stage.
Ayla
We see many a hero in a time as turbulent as ours.
Ayla
They're the embers that have rekindled our hopes in bringing back our home and restoring human civilization to its previous glory.
Ayla
And while we may not be able to rise to their heights due to personal limitations...
Ayla
Art has made it possible for us to pass down their glorious stories for future generations to remember.
Ayla
We record, we tell, and we think.
Ayla
And it's through all these wonderful works we have here that our heroes will forever shine through and point us toward a bright future we all want to see...
Right then, specks of golden starlight arise from under the stage—no doubt a stroke of genius on WGAA's part.
Surrounded by innumerable stars, Ayla's eyes beam in gold. Through the golden shafts of light on the stage, she holds her hand out to you with a smile.
The Muses.
The names of goddesses that you came across a few days ago in a mythology book come to your mind...
Because at this very moment, that's what Ayla looks like to you.
You pull out your notebook and start drawing away—and before long, you see Ayla's outline staring back at you.
Ayla
Gone may be time, but here to stay shall art.
Ayla
May the world's long-lost love and glories flower alongside the blossom come next spring...
You snap back to your senses at the commotion now rippling through the crowd in the dim banquet hall.
With Ayla's speech coming to an end, Allen does a quick wrap-up and sets the banquet in motion.
Ayla
Commandant, over here!
Ayla waves at you by the long table.
Ayla now blushes with a radiance of red—and you can't quite tell if it's because it was too hot up there on the stage, or if it's because the celebratory drink she had backstage has kicked in.
Picking up a glass of alcohol-flavor electrolyte from the table, she gestures for you to follow her outside through the side entrance.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory264.png
The small plaza outside the side entrance is set aglow by the street lamps. It's quiet out here because everyone else is busy socializing in the hall.
Are you sure people will leave you alone for the rest of the night?
Ayla
Don't worry. I already told my agent that I wanted to be left alone.
Ayla
It's not every day we get to hang out at a place like this, and the last thing I want to do now is try to make small talk with people.
With squinted eyes, Ayla curls a finger with the hair by her chest.
Ayla
Well, unless you are, you know, too busy to hang out with me, Commandant.
Still got two hours before I have to go.
Ayla
That's great, then.
Ayla
So I noticed that you weren't really listening to my speech!
Ayla
And I just wanted you to know that I was upset, because I toiled over it knowing that you'd be here.
But I did pick up every word you said.
Ayla
Oh, really? Which part is your favorite, then?
Gone may be time, but here to stay shall art.
Ayla
So I see you only heard the very last line, huh...
Crossing her arms, Ayla feigns a pouty face.
Ayla
I totally caught you writing things in your notebook, and I bet it's either some new strategy or a meeting summary...
With Ayla staring menacingly at you, you decide it'll be in your best interest to show her your notebook.
Well, this is what I was "writing down" just now.
Ayla
Huh??
Ayla
So you were drawing me?
Pleasantly surprised, Ayla carefully tears the page off your notebook and takes her time appreciating it under the street light.
Ayla
I see you're making good progress there, Commandant!
Ayla
Good job getting the shape right, and you're doing significantly better with transparency, too...
Taking a few sips from her glass, Ayla breaks into a sudden smile, the light from the street lamps glimmering in her eyes.
Ayla
But you're still missing something here.
Ayla
You're missing some colors. Gotta do this drawing justice with colors, no?
I don't have paint with me, though...
Ayla
Paint? Who said we're using paint?
Ayla
Here, let me show you...
With her lips perked up, Ayla dips a tissue paper with the golden liquid from her glass and dabs it around the girl in the drawing.
Moments later, the picture glitters with golden specks.
Ayla
See, paint isn't the only thing that can do the magic.
Says Ayla proudly as she displays her work.
This is gorgeous.
Ayla
I'm not done yet, though.
Curiously, Ayla puts her index finger straight up as she picks up the picture...
Psst.
You see fire coming out of her finger.
She holds her finger close to the picture, allowing the orange flame to blur the lines in it.
Then, she sets the picture aflame.
Ayla
Amazing... right?
The girl in the picture seems to be dancing among flames as they snake across the paper along where the golden liquid has been dabbed, casting a glow on Ayla's blushed cheeks.
This, of course, is due to the combustion point and corrosivity of alcohol-flavor electrolyte—but still...
Amazing indeed.
Her eyes smiling like the crescent moon, Ayla puts the fire out and raises the paper.
The streaks left behind by the fire allow the light from the street lamps to pass through, lighting up the entire space behind the girl in the picture.
Ayla
I'm keeping this one, too, then.
Ayla
And I promise to take good care of it.
Before you even get to say anything, Ayla has already put the drawing away into her clipboard as though she thinks you might say no.
Ayla
Oh no... I'm seeing a message from my agent.
Ayla
But we haven't even caught up yet...
There's always a next time.
Ayla
Right... guess it's gotta be next time, then.
Ayla
Let's head back to the banquet hall. Have you tried that snack they ordered this time? I assure you it's super delicious...
The two of you stand shrouded in the night breeze, dragging long shadows behind you under the street lamps.
